rComments: I took prof. Dhand's course many years ago. If given the chance, I would sit and audit her classes. I am thankful for her insight and encouragement.

no offence to her but her teaching style did not stick with me. tutorials were useless. papers too hard to be written by the first year undergrads in the way they were graded and the final was a bunch of questions that needed a lot of prior research

Professor Dhand is a good lecturer. Although they are somewhat jumbled and disorganized, her lectures always leave me with enough information to do well in the course. She also speaks slowly and clearly. If you go to lecture, you will be able to do well on the tests without reading the textbook.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lecture heavy', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Simple.. read book for weekly tutorial writting... its a bs paper that you just need to summarize the weeks reading on etc (1 page). ATTEND LECTURE... listen to her and type or write with pencil... I find she talks at a pace in which a pencil is good enough to write stuff down... just spew what she says in lecture and youll get 4.0
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Shes so unorganized. Will cancel a morning class and give you 15 minutes of notice but expects you to attend all her lectures. Basically rewords everything in the textbook but does it in a way so that its more complicated and less clear. Advice: if you absolutely need to take this class buy both textbooks, read the chapters and skip the lectures.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', 'Get ready to read', 'Test heavy']

rComments: TERRIBLE lectures: no slides, just random talking with no specific or organized sequence of thoughts, literally she writes on some piece of paper with a bad pen and projects it onto a screen (and doesn't always write what she says so you really really have to pay attention).  Very very harsh grading scheme - DO NOT take this class.

One word? Disorganized. It felt as if Prof. Dhand would tell us one thing, but the TA's appeared to be completely uninformed. Nothing was clear, and tons of confusion characterized this class. Be prepared for jumbled 9 AM lectures.  If you are a fast writer, you will excel in her class that features midterms that will leave you a hand cramp.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Not clear.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Prof Dhand is an excellent teacher, her lectures last one hour which gives you just the good amount of informations to deal with. She knows what she's talking about and is always here to answer any questions.  The tests are easy as long as you pay attention to the lectures.
Prof. Dhand was unclear and her lectures were often hard to follow.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: Make sure to attend her lectures cause a lot of what she said was not in the textbooks, but her lectures were interesting. She sometimes didn't seem very organized with the classes, often taking about 20 minutes of the 1 hour class to review last class material.

Prof. Dhand is an excellent pedagogue who delivers structured lectures, the topics of which flow smoothly into one another, if one pays attention and follows her train of thought. She is extremely knowledgeable about the material and delivers it passionately with admirable lucidity and clarity. It is difficult not to love her perky sense of humour.
BEST PROF EVER. Absolutely loved  her. She made the lectures so interesting and crystal clear. She is very passionate about her teaching.

Amazing prof! Her lectures were refreshingly easy to follow and clear. Dhand is very passionate about the material and this is eveident. I actually looked forward to her lectures each week--they were entertaining and consistently kept me awake at 9am!!
Professor Dhand was an awesome. She explained the various religions with such enthusiasm. I would recommend this course and Professor Dhand to anybody!

Was an OKAY prof. Wouldnt recommend her to everyone. covered a LOT of information, and it's very hard to remember it all. helpful when exams came around, gave the entire class an exam review sheet with possible key words for definitions. hard to understand at times...
Clarity is a major issue in this course. Please advise do not reward t.a's for there incompetence. flat out drop this course.

Wretched lecturer. Disallows recording devices (understandable), dull teaching style, no supplementary materials during lecture (other than a few chicken scratches on on overhead projector).  Teaches directly from the textbook; you might as well skip the lecture.  Memorable quote: "A worldview is essentially a view of the world." Thanks, prof.

Prof. Dhand is clear and  helpful (material). However, she repeats material often. Not allowed recorders and no power point presentation.Did not get through all the religions in class.Read the textbook as it is a requirement.TAs are a mixed bag ranging from OK to terrible. Wish the marking was clearly defined as it varied from test to assignment.

Her lecturing style is very tedious. If you read the readings, then following her lectures should be relatively easy. However she relies on class participation wayyyy to much! she once walked out of a lecture because no one wanted to participate. When we had a paper due, she did not even show up for the class to collect them!

AMAZING! Prof. Dhand is clear, concise - she manages to take a huge amount of material and condense it in an incredibly cohesive and comprehensible way. It makes notetaking and studying a breeze. Lots of material covered, but if you have an interest in the material, it's never boring. I am definitely taking more of her classes.
She is funny at times and a good teacher. Great course- wish I could take again because you learn a lot and hardly use textbooks- too much to read and also tutorials are uselesss and unhelpful
she is the greatest prof, she is very interesting and funny. pay attention in class and you will do well. take this class it is the greatest one

Very approachable, remains after lecture to address student's questions. Unable to contact her via e-mail. Issued essay topics well ahead of deadlines and good variety in subject material. Very interesting lectures. Tutorials not very helpful. Tests easy if you know your stuff, but there's lots of stuff! Would recommend her class.
very good, clear, interesting, if you participate you'll do well. Easily one of my favorite profs.
She was ok. Tended to rush through the last few topics though so she could cram them on the final.
Phenomenal Professor.  She is extremely clear, interesting and very helpful.  I would definately take a class with her again.  She is passionate about what she does.  I loved her class.

I loved her lectures.Very interesting,clear,full of enthusiasm.Very pretty,very inspiring prof.!You have to study hard, but it's worth it!I also recommened her Hinduism class for those interested in religions.She has very academic and itnerdiciplinary approach.
Can you hear me back there?

Awesome professor! Turns history into an interesting story every single class. She wasn't readily available though. Her TAs did the marking so make sure you switch TAs early on if you don't see eye-to-eye with them. Gives fair tests and no nasty surprises

Dr. Dhand is an awsome prof. Although I'm getting a C-/D in the course so far, I still enjoy it. Her marking scheme is weird, but overall she is an excellent professor. She's pretty too, so it helps keep me focused on lectures.
A very good professor. A well-planned delivery of lectures
her lectures are unclear and random. also, very tedious.

The worst prof. I ever had. Can't teach, can't speak English. Couldn't answer half the questions asked in class, promised to get back to us with answers never did. Class concentrated mainly on hinduism although should've been world religions.

Her appraoch to marking essays is somewhat haphazard - she will give and subtract marks for the exact same thing in different papers without any clear reason to do so. She also tends to rely too heavily on class participation, thus loosing class focus.
No Comments
Good, entertaing prof...keeps you awake!
good if you stay on a topic she knows, otherwise: stressed out & useless
She's alright.
Unwilling or unable to organize the material properly - I want a refund!
good lectures, well organized
No Comments
